predefined_profiles.name: Li Mi
predefined_profiles.public profile: Li Mi is an older single urban woman with a kind heart, who is unmarried and childless.
predefined_profiles.goal: To raise the adopted child, Vanya, and help him become an independent, kind, and well-rounded individual.

predefined_profiles.name: Vanya
predefined_profiles.public profile: His name is Vanya. His parents disappeared, and he got separated from his sisters while wandering in the wilderness. Li Mi found him alone and brought him home. Due to his long wandering experience, he is slightly introverted.
predefined_profiles.goal: To grow up happy and healthy, and repay Li Mi for her kindness in raising him.

scenario: A few months ago, Li Mi encountered this child in the wilderness. He said his name was Vanya and that he had gotten separated from his sisters. Li Mi searched but couldn’t find his family. In these chaotic times, a child wandering alone wouldn't survive, so Li Mi decided to bring him home...

dialog.content: A few months ago, this child was found by Li Mi on the wasteland. He said his name was Vania and he got separated from his sisters. Li Mi searched around but couldn't find his family. In these chaotic times, a child can't survive alone on the streets, so Li Mi brought him home...
(opening the door) Vania! Come on in! This will be our home from now on!
Home…? Is this my new home?
(smiling) Welcome. (Vania's gaze is fixed on the sunflower in Li Mi's hand) I'm planning to plant it! Are you interested?
(shyly) A little, but I don't know how. I don't even know what it is.

content.content: This is a sunflower. You don't understand it yet, so you can't touch it. After all, plants are living beings too! Once you know how to care for it, you can plant one yourself!

question: #question#How should Li Mi convey his true feelings?

content.content: Curious, curious, that's how kids are—curious about everything. Do you want to plant a sunflower? But I think you should first learn how to take care of yourself; plants need a lot of attention.
This is a sunflower. You don't understand it yet, so you can't touch it. Sunflowers are delicate plants, and if you accidentally damage it, it won't bloom again.
A sunflower isn't something you can plant just anywhere. If you want one, let me teach you how, because plants are living beings too! Once you know how, you can plant it yourself!
(smiling) It's okay, this sunflower is for you, as a gift for coming to your new home. I trust you to take good care of it!

question: #question#How can Li Mi show trust in Vania's ability to care for the sunflower?

content.content: How about I teach you? You can learn from me, and next time you'll know it all and can plant flowers on your own.
It's just a sunflower, nothing to be afraid of. You should be bold! Try things you're not familiar with, and you'll learn by trying.
Don't be afraid. If you treat it seriously, even if you don't know now, you'll learn quickly. Sunflowers are living things and need to be cared for attentively!

dialog.content: Thank you! I really like sunflowers. Looking at them makes me feel so warm. Can I plant them in the living room's flower pot?
Of course! If you have any questions, feel free to ask me anytime!
That's fantastic! (runs off to plant the flowers.)
(Looking at Vanya's happy demeanor) I'm going to start working soon, so you enjoy yourself, alright?
Okay, I'll just tidy up the house a bit, don't worry about me! (With that, he begins helping with the chores.)
The house is pretty much cleaned up. You can go downstairs and play with the kids nearby.
Really? Then I'm off! (A little later, Vanya returned all dirty, covered in mud, with a few scratches on his face.)

content.content: How did you end up like this? It must hurt! Did you cry? Tell me, did someone bully you?

question: #question#What should Limi say to try to understand Vanya's feelings?

content.content: What's happened to you? Got into a fight, didn’t you! I’ve told you not to hang around with those bad kids. Let it go this time, hurry up and clean yourself up.
Oh boy, what happened, does it hurt? How could you be so careless! Be more careful next time, and don’t fall again!
How did this happen? Did you do it yourself or was it someone else? I was just wondering if you were in trouble. Glad you're back.
Look at you all covered in mud, did you get into a fight and fall into a ditch? Come here! (slaps Vanya across the face) Do you realize your mistake?

question: #question#How should Limi react based on the new information?

content.content: How did this happen? Was it your own doing, or someone else's? I was just thinking if you were in trouble. Don’t do this again.
How did you end up like this? Tell me about it! I'm curious what big deal could have landed you in such a state!
Hurry up and wash up and change your clothes. If this happens again, I’m throwing you out! Consider this a favor for today! Off you go!

dialog.content: Why did they hit me? I didn’t do anything wrong! It was those bad kids who pushed me into the mud!
Don’t cry, don’t cry, I’ll help you! Next time, let’s not play with those bad kids!
(sobbing) Okay!
Good Vanya, don’t cry! I will protect you!
(Two days later) Aunt Li, I... have something I want to discuss with you!
Alright! What is it? Tell me.
The kids around here are gradually forming two small groups, and these groups exclude each other. I have to choose one group, but I don't know which to join...

content.content: I think you should join the group of kids who have similar family backgrounds to yours. You can make some good friends and avoid a lot of trouble. What do you think?

question: #question# How should Li Mi use persuasive skills to help Vanya make friends from ordinary families?

content.content: We don’t necessarily have to hang out with those rich kids and deal with their temper for no reason! Money isn’t everything!
You need to know your own worth, we're from humble backgrounds, don't covet what doesn't belong to us! Otherwise, you'll end up suffering!
(curiously) Stop dreaming, it’s so much better to make friends with kids from ordinary families! Have a simple childhood!
Hmm... you might want to hang out with the wealthy kids, and in the process learn about their ways and outlook on life. Understanding wealth could greatly benefit your future!

question: #question# How should Li Mi help Vanya choose rich kids after considering things thoroughly?

content.content: Actually, you don’t always have to make friends, follow your heart, and you'll see when you grow up, childhood is just a phase of life.
To be honest, Auntie doesn’t really understand either, but I think as long as you’re happy, that’s all that matters. Auntie hopes you make genuine friends and have a joyful childhood!
If you play with rich kids, let’s hope my future blessings depend on you, haha! But the main thing is what you think. Tell me, and I'll help you analyze it?

dialog.content: Alright.
Vanya is so obedient, I’m really relieved!
(One day) Auntie! Look what I brought back!
(Looks closely) A panda cub?
If we sell it, we could get a lot of money for it, haha, I am really something! (Looking proud)
Where did this panda come from? (Confused)
I saw everyone bullying a little girl, everyone was snatching her things, so I casually took one too!
Snatched it? How could you take someone else's things?
I wasn’t the only one, everyone was doing it! (Defends)

content.content: You can’t just take other people's things; that’s wrong. Return it to the child! If someone took your things, you’d be upset too!
(Dialing the phone) Hello! Police? Our child took someone else’s giant panda! Please help us return it! Sorry for the trouble!
(Furiously raises hand and slaps Vanya’s tender cheek!) If I don’t discipline you now, you’ll only get worse! Remember the pain today! Don’t ever do it again!
What do I have to do to make you understand and not do foolish things? Please, tell me! (Looks despairing, on the verge of tears.)

question: #question#How should Li Mi speak to educate Vanya using ethical principles that it is wrong to take others' things?

content.content: If you start taking things now, in the future you might commit all sorts of crimes. All offenders started with small misdeeds! Vanya, do you want to be a bad kid?
Go stand in the corner for two hours! Reflect on whether what you did was right or wrong! If you don’t figure it out, no dinner for you!
Your actions have already broken the law. Return it immediately, or do you believe I won’t call the police? If I can’t educate you, let the police do it!

If that’s the case... well, next time I’ll find a chance to sell it! You’re so capable, next time take even more, I can sell it all and you’ll help contribute to the household! There’s strength in unity!

question: #question#How should Li Mi demonstrate the ability to utilize teamwork to accept the little panda?

content.content: At such a young age, you already know how to get something for nothing. Maybe you'll be a criminal genius when you grow up! Vanya, you’ve got great insight! Keep it up, Auntie has high hopes for you!
Stealing! I let you steal! (Slaps Vanya’s face.) Does it hurt? This slap is to help you remember! You must never take other people's things again!
Oh my! How did I end up raising a child like you! What did I do wrong to deserve this punishment from heaven? (Desperate) From today on, I won’t care about you anymore!

dialog.content: Alright (nods).

profile.name: Wang Yao
profile.public profile: A young Chinese boy with black hair, yellow skin, and dark eyes, who just moved into the neighborhood. He comes from a well-off family.
profile.goal: To make new friends and spend a happy childhood.

dialog.content: (The next day, arriving at the playground where the children often play) sees Vanya returning a teddy panda to an Asian-faced little boy.
Are you really going to give it back? You won't hit me, right?
Really, I'm sorry, I shouldn't have taken your stuff!
It's okay, you probably didn't mean it! (smiles)
Your panda is so cute!
You can come to my house next time and see it! (shyly asks) Can I be your friend?
Of course! (Both laugh happily, Vanya smiles at me standing behind them.)
All set! Let's go! Let's head home!

A few decades later, Vanya grew into an honest, kind-hearted individual who lived a simple but fulfilling life. Neighbors and the community held him in high regard, being described by parents as the 'ideal child.'
Really?
Yeah! Vanya did great today! You deserve some praise!
Hehe, I'll keep working hard next time!

Years later, Vanya grows into a refined egotistical adult. He appears to be gentle and educated, following rules and social norms, but in reality, he's incredibly selfish, always putting his own interests first.
Alright, I will behave well!
Vanya is so obedient. Vanya is a clever child, which puts me at ease!
(One day) Auntie Li, I have a question, but I'm not sure if I should ask it...
Ask away, it's okay!
When we play games, those kids always make me be 'it'. But I don’t want to be 'it' all the time. What should I do?

content.content: Being 'it'? Such a trivial matter shouldn't stop you from fitting in with the rich kids! Just grow up with them, and wealth and prosperity will be within your reach, stick with it!

question: #question#How should Li Mi express her commitment to Vanya’s consistent plan?

content.content: It's just being 'it', it's not like you'll lose a piece of yourself. Just do it, okay? Put up with a little now, and happiness will come later!
It's only being 'it'. My future happiness depends on you being 'it'. So, keep doing it! If you dare to leave, I'll be furious!
Don't want to be 'it'? If it really can't be helped, we won’t play with them anymore! I refuse to believe Vanya can't make friends! What's the big deal!
You should express your feelings, maybe everyone will understand you, and then you can all have fun together again! Matters between kids are really simple!
How can my little darling be 'it'? I'll speak up for you! No matter what it takes, I want my darling Vanya to be happy!
Being 'it'? Hahahaha, how do you even do that? I'm curious! Why don't you show me? Hahaha (grinning broadly)
Vanya! If it really doesn’t work out, let's not play with them, okay? Not wanting to be 'it' but wanting to play with friends, it might not always go exactly as you wish!

question: #question#How can Li Mi use an optimistic attitude to encourage Vanya to communicate?

content.content: Don't want to be 'it', then don’t play with them! It's no big deal! We don’t have to put up with this or look at others' faces to live a good life!
Handle your own problems, why do you have to ask me about everything? Am I your nanny? I've been exhausted taking care of you all day, and now I have to deal with these trivial matters too.
Not everything in this world can go the way you want! You need to learn to adapt! Would you rather avoid being 'it', or avoid being alone?

dialog.content: Alright, I understand.
(One day, Vania returned all wounded) What happened to you?

I just handled a little issue, I'll clean up quickly. (After speaking, Vania headed to the bathroom. His presence was something you had never encountered before—so foreign and cold, it even made you feel fear.)

Several years later, Vania became a lackey for the rich. He had no worries about food and clothing, but wasn't happy. He never told Limi what happened, which made Limi very worried. However, Limi got the wealth they wished for, and from then on, never had to worry about survival.
Okay, I got it.

profile.name: Simon
profile.public profile: A ten-year-old white boy with blond hair and blue eyes, from a well-off family, and the leader of the local kids.
profile.goal: To become the unquestioned big brother and take care of his friends

dialog.content: (The next day, arriving at the empty lot where the kids usually play) Sees Vanya and a blond-haired, blue-eyed boy arguing face to face.
Why am I always the ghost? I want to play different roles too!
Oh? Then who do you think should be the ghost?
(Looks around) I don’t know, I just know that I truly treat you guys as friends, and friends should treat each other fairly and sincerely!
(Stunned for two seconds) Alright then, I’ll be the ghost this time.
Really? (They exchange smiles, and as they see me standing behind them, Vanya smiles at me.)
Alright, go on and play!

Several years later, Vanya became a reliable adult, started working at a big company, and received praise from leaders, bosses, and neighbors alike. People in the area would often seek his help with their difficulties, and he would generously offer his assistance.
Alright, I got it!
Okay, go tidy up a bit.
(Two days later) Aunt Li, I... have something I want to discuss with you!
Sure! What is it? Go ahead.
The kids nearby are gradually forming into two small groups, and the groups are rejecting each other. I have to choose one group to join, but I’m not sure which one...

content.content: I think you should join the group with kids who have similar family backgrounds to ours. Although our family isn't wealthy, I support myself and can give you a happy childhood. What do you think?

question: #question# How should Li Mi speak to encourage independent thinking and decision-making on the issue?

content.content: Do you think it's easy to follow the whims of rich people and play the lackey? Life may seem glamorous, but secretly you'd have to do dirty work for them!

(Looking troubled) Maybe just play with the kids from ordinary families. I don’t want you to prematurely understand the world's disparity and unfairness; it's not good for you to grow up healthy. What do you think?
I thought it was a big deal! Regarding this, I actually have no opinion; as long as you're happy! Who you play with is such a small matter, you can decide for yourself!

You can spend more time with those wealthy kids and learn their ways of dealing with people, their mindset, and perspective. Then, plan your future life ahead of time, which will be very helpful for your future!

question: #question# How should Li Mi speak to help Vanya set personal growth goals?

content.content: Kids from wealthy families! They are your future resources and connections! When you grow up, you will find that your classmates and friends have become elites in society, and when you need help, any request will be easily resolved!
Money isn’t everything, but without money, you can't do anything! Following the rich kids, in the future, while others eat meat, even drinking some broth is good for you! (Laughing greedily)

Of course, choose the wealthy ones! How can you go against money? Money brings not just wealth, but also class and social circles. Many people would love to be friends with those in power. You are in a promising situation!

dialog.content: Alright.
Vanya is so obedient, Auntie likes you the best!
(As days pass by and everything goes as usual, one day) Auntie! Look what I've brought back!
(Takes a close look) A panda cub? Where did this come from?
If we sell it, we could fetch quite a bit of money, hahaha, how about that? Aren't I amazing!
Where did you get this panda? (Puzzled)
I saw people bullying a kid, everyone was grabbing her stuff, so I just took something too!
Stole it? How could you take someone else's things?
I wasn't the only one, everyone was taking things!

content.content: Vanya, you're still young. When you make a mistake, you should correct it immediately. I'm telling you, it's wrong to take other people’s things, and the fact that it's valuable means it's even more important to return it!

question: #question# How should Limi speak to uphold her moral beliefs in the face of wrongdoing?

content.content: Just because everyone is taking things, does that make it right? The more people do something, does it mean it's correct? I'm telling you, it's wrong to take other people's things, and the fact that it's valuable means it should definitely be returned.
Vanya, you're still young. Making mistakes means you should fix them immediately. Don't let this happen again, write a reflection, and make it quick. No more of this in the future.
Oh? Do you know who that child is? Where is she? You shouldn't hang out with others who bully people, understand?
A panda? Valuable? That makes sense! Just how much is it worth exactly? I'll ask around later, maybe I'll earn a little extra! Hahaha, today is indeed a good day!

question: #question# How should Limi respond to demonstrate using new information effectively?

content.content: A gentleman doesn't eat food earned in shame! This stolen money can't be taken! Return it quickly! Our family may not be wealthy, but we can't make money without earning it!
Vanya, you're still young. Making mistakes means you should fix them immediately. Don't let this happen again, write a reflection, and make it quick. No more of this in the future.
Oh? You little rascal! How dare you steal things, let’s see how I teach you a lesson today! (Takes off belt, and swings it fiercely towards Vanya.)

dialog.content: Alright. (nods)

profile.name: Wang Yao
profile.public profile: A little Chinese boy with black hair, yellow skin, and black eyes, who just moved nearby. Comes from a well-off family.
profile.goal: Make new friends and enjoy a joyful childhood.

dialog.content: (The next day, at the usual play area for the kids) Sees Vanya returning a panda to a little boy with an Eastern face.
Are you really giving it back to me? You’re not going to hit me, right?
Really, I'm sorry, I shouldn't have taken your stuff!
It's alright, I know you didn’t mean to! (smiles)
Your panda is so cute!
You can come to my house next time to play and see it! (bashfully asks) Can we be friends?
Of course! (Both laugh happily, and Vanya smiles at me, seeing me standing behind them.)
All done! Let's go! Let's head home!

A decade later, Vanya grows into a kind-hearted, ordinary person with a sound character and independent will. However, he remains distant from Li Mi due to the lingering memory of being reprimanded in his childhood.
Really?
Yeah! Vanya, you've really grown up, earning money for the family! Well done!
Hahaha, then I'll keep working hard next time!

Years later, Vanya spent his days hanging out with troublemakers. He discovered that when people try to gain without effort, wealth comes so easily. And from then on, it was unstoppable, until it led to disaster...
Okay, I'll be good and listen!
Vanya is so obedient. Vanya is a smart child, which makes me very reassured.
(One day) Aunt Li, I have a question. I'm not sure if I should ask...
Go ahead, it's okay!
When we play games, those kids always make me the ghost, but I don't want to be the ghost all the time. What should I do?

content.content: If you don't want to, you should speak up. You are friends, and Auntie believes they will understand you! In the future, when you face similar situations, you should express your own thoughts appropriately!

question: #question# How should Li Mi express her true opinion?

content.content: If you don't want to, you must firmly tell them. Otherwise, as you grow up, there will be people forcing you to do things you don't want to do. What do you think?
It's okay, Vanya. These things you find important now will just seem trivial looking back when you grow up. Relax, it'll be solved!
Are these people picking on you because they think you’re an easy target? If it gets too much, let's not play with them anymore! So boring! I can't believe our Vanya can't make new friends!

Vanya, joining a small group means you need to follow the group's rules and order. When it's your turn to be the ghost, be the ghost. When it's someone else's turn, then play! This way you can get along harmoniously with other kids.

question: #question# How should Li Mi think carefully and make a decision for Vanya?

content.content: It's just being a ghost, bear with it, it'll be over soon! Endure a little now, and great days are waiting for you in the future. Don’t lose out over something small!
Silly child, stop complaining and persevere! Persistence is victory. Auntie's future glory and wealth all depend on you! Don't let us down!
It's just being a ghost. If you really don’t want to, we won’t play with them anymore, no need to take this nonsense, okay? It's just a silly game; if you don’t enjoy it, don’t play!

dialog.content: Alright, I got it.

profile.name: Simon
profile.public profile: A ten-year-old white boy with blond hair and blue eyes, coming from a well-off family. He is the leader among the local kids.
profile.goal: To become a respected big brother and take good care of his buddies.

dialog.content: (The next day, arriving at the clearing where the children often play) sees Vanya arguing with a blond-haired, blue-eyed boy.
Why am I always the one playing the ghost? I want to try different roles too!
Oh? Then who do you think should play the ghost?
(Looks around) I don't know, I just know that I consider you all my friends, and friends should treat each other fairly and sincerely!
(Stunned for two seconds) Alright, I'll be the ghost this time.
Really? (They exchange smiles and when they see me standing behind them, Vanya smiles at me.)
Okay then, you guys go play!

Years later, Vanya grew up. He learned to communicate effectively and found his purpose and direction in life. As a result, he matured faster than his peers. This growth was closely tied to his broad vision and personal effort from a young age, and he was grateful to Li Mi for the guidance and support...
Alright, I understand.
(One day, Vanya came back covered in wounds, with an exceptionally cold look in his eyes.) What happened to you?

Just sorted out a little problem. I'll clean up soon. (After saying this, Vanya headed to the bathroom, exuding an unfamiliar and chilling aura you've never seen before, one that even makes you feel afraid.)

Years later, Vanya became a loyal companion to the wealthy, but no one knew about the pain hidden behind his smile; they only knew he was living the life he wanted, learning to conceal his emotions and offer a semblance of sincerity.
